name: Iceland
description: A Nordic island nation known for its dramatic landscapes and frequent use as a filming location.

content.title: Overview
content.body: **Iceland** is a Nordic island nation renowned for its stunning natural landscapes including volcanoes, geysers, hot springs, and lava fields. Reykjavik, the capital, runs on geothermal power and is home to the National and Saga museums, tracing Iceland’s Viking history. The unique terrain and untamed natural wonders make Iceland a popular location for filming.

content.title: Film History
content.body: Iceland's diverse landscapes have been featured in numerous films and TV series. Notably, it was used for filming parts of *Game of Thrones*, portraying the icy lands beyond the Wall. Movies like *Interstellar*, directed by Christopher Nolan, utilized Iceland's rugged terrain to depict otherworldly locations, such as Mann’s Planet. The film *Batman Begins* also shot scenes here, showcasing the island's dramatic environments.

content.title: Visiting
content.body: Iceland is accessible to tourists year-round, with many locations offering guided tours that highlight the natural beauty as well as sites used for filming. Visitors can explore the Vatnajökull and Snæfellsjökull National Parks, attend Reykjavik's cultural events, or relax in the Blue Lagoon, an iconic geothermal spa.
